Donald Rumsfeld takes particular offense at Colin Powell 's contention that he was misled by faulty intelligence into making the public case for the invasion of Iraq. " Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody," Donald Rumsfeld writes. Nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie.( CIA Director President Bush ) Tenet did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie.... The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Even so, Donald Rumsfeld - who does reveal that President Bush asked for Iraq invasion plans within days of 9/11- argues that removing Saddam Hussein was the right thing to do.
